pages.text: The $(#490)Imbuing Table$() is the heart of your magical journey. The soulfire burning within provides a limitless supply of magical energy... $(o)if$() you are willing to offer the necessary ingredients and a piece of your soul.$(br2)Surround the table with bookshelves to boost its power.

pages.name: Imbuing Table Setup
pages.text: Displayed is the maximum setup for the imbuing table. Fewer shelves yield less power.

pages.title: Enchanting
pages.text: The imbuing table can function as an advanced $(#490)Enchanting Table$(). Enchantable items are inserted into the middle slot and Lapis Lazuli into the marked lapis slot. $(br)The imbuing table can enchant items up to level $(l)60$(), twice the cap of the enchanting table. To achieve this level of enchanting power, the table can be surrounded by $(l)30$() bookshelves rather than 15. The same bookshelf arrangement requirements apply.

pages.title: Rerolling
pages.text: If enabled in the mod configurations (it is enabled by default), you can reroll the enchantments in the imbuing table by clicking the refresh button that shows up between the right two imbuing slots.$(br2)This reroll requires lapis and experience levels, and the button will grey out if you don't have enough of one or both.

pages.title: Imbuing
pages.text: Imbuing is one of the primary tasks you will need to accomplish to progress in your magical journey. Imbuing is a hybrid of crafting and enchanting; it is the act of infusing an object with the essence of other objects, as well as with some of your own soul. In gameplay, your $(#490)Experience$() stands in for your soul.

pages.title: Imbuing
pages.text: You can find recipes for imbuements throughout this tome that show both the items required as well as the experience levels needed.$(br2)For sections dedicated to various imbuing recipes see the $(#490)$(l)$(l:amethyst_imbuement:imbuing)Imbuing$() and $(#490)$(l)$(l:amethyst_imbuement:augments)Augments$() categories, but there are also other imbuing recipes elsewhere in the book.
